thread.title: Got Electric Donates 127 Solar Panels to Support Habitat for Humanity PR Newswire
thread.title_full: Got Electric Donates 127 Solar Panels to Support Habitat for Humanity PR Newswire

author: Got Electric, LLC
title: Got Electric Donates 127 Solar Panels to Support Habitat for Humanity PR Newswire
text:
Got Electric Donates 127 Solar Panels to Support Habitat for Humanity PR Newswire Today at 12:00pm UTC Got Electric Donates 127 Solar Panels to Support Habitat for Humanity PR Newswire
IJAMSVILLE, Md., Oct. 16, 2025
IJAMSVILLE, Md. , Oct. 16, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Got Electric, LLC, a leading Maryland -based electrical and solar contractor, has donated 127 surplus solar panels to Habitat for Humanity Virginia through its partnership with GiveSolar. The panels, already delivered to Athens, Georgia , will be installed on the Athens Area Habitat for Humanity ReStore. This initiative will reduce operating costs for the ReStore, allowing Habitat to direct more resources toward its mission of building affordable housing for families in need.
The collaboration grew from a simple conversation between Got Electric's Andy Hershberger and GiveSolar's Director, Jeff Heie . Recognizing the opportunity to repurpose surplus equipment, Hershberger coordinated the donation to advance renewable energy access while helping reduce inventory.
"We are honored to support Habitat for Humanity Virginia and GiveSolar in their mission to bring affordable housing and renewable energy together," said Andy Hershberger , Director of Virginia Operations of Got Electric, LLC. "By donating these solar panels, we're not only reducing waste but also helping Habitat lower their energy expenses so more funds can go directly toward building homes for families who need them most."
"This donation is a great example of how surplus solar equipment can be redirected to make a real difference in local communities," said Jeff Heie , Director of GiveSolar. "With support from companies like Got Electric, Habitat for Humanity can expand its impactâ€”providing both affordable housing and the benefits of clean, renewable energy."
The donated panels were delivered by Estes Express Lines and unloaded with the help of volunteers and equipment at the Athens ReStore. The partnership between Got Electric, GiveSolar, and Habitat for Humanity underscores the power of collaboration in advancing sustainability and community impact.
About Got Electric, LLC
Got Electric, LLC, based in Ijamsville, Maryland , is a trusted provider of electrical and solar solutions across the Mid-Atlantic region. With expertise in residential, commercial, and solar operations and maintenance services, Got Electric is committed to delivering high-quality workmanship, advancing renewable energy, and supporting the communities it serves. Learn more at gotelectric.net .
About GiveSolar
GiveSolar is a mission-driven nonprofit committed to expanding access to solar energy for low-income households. By reducing energy costs and promoting environmental sustainability, they help build more resilient and equitable communities across the United States . In addition to making solar accessible to Habitat families, GiveSolar also facilitates donations of surplus solar panels and equipment to power Habitat ReStores nationwide, thereby reducing their operating expenses so that these funds can be directed to their core mission of building more affordable housing.
About Habitat for Humanity
Habitat for Humanity is a global nonprofit housing organization working in local communities across all 50 states and in more than 70 countries. Habitat's vision is a world where everyone has a decent place to live. Through affordable housing construction and innovative partnerships, Habitat helps families build strength, stability, and self-reliance.

SOURCE Got Electric, LLC
